Reviews.Title: “Ok for price”
Reviews.Author: NormstromO
Reviews.Content: Not the most pleasant hotel but for the price, but it meets expectations. Plastic coverings on bed, no shower curtain, small room. Cleanliness questionable but tolerable. Not too far from metro.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of a red light district. If you're okay with that, then this is a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JasonRupp
Reviews.Content: Compared with the other Hotel 81s around Geylang this may be the best, but only marginally. The rooms are a little bigger, but maybe by a half meter. I do like the big windows. Be aware that this hotel is in the middle of a red light district. That said, it is a great location to get into CDB (central business district) quickly by the many buses that stop here. Wifi internet was free, but slow.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, in interesting neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bassailor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights. Booked for $60US/night on agoda.com. Asked for a quiet room, they gave me one on top floor in the back. Big window, lots of natural light. Rooms are clean and modern but small. Flat screen TV too small and internet frustratingly slow (but free). Lots of hookers hanging around outside, but they are polite and the neighborhood is surprisingly quiet. Hundreds of good, cheap restaurants nearby. 15 minutes walk to MRT, but plenty of bus lines. Good choice for open-minded, cheap traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adaminyemen
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I go to Singapore and I'm paying the bill. Stayed at other budget hotels in Singapore and all have some things in common. For me, this is the best one. If a room isn't suitable they'll find a new one for you. 12 minute walk to the Aljunied MRT station. If you want better, you have to pay more...

Reviews.Title: “Ok for transit but not longer stay”
Reviews.Author: chicagoball
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a transit stop and it was ok. I do not mind being in Geylang and if you understand it's a red light area and can live with it, why not? The good thing about Geylang, if you are a foodie, is the massing number of restaurants in the area service excellent local foods. Everything is available, and is cheap and delicious. What I didn't like about the hotel was the aircon was too warm, so much so I really had a tough time sleeping. For that reason alone, I will not stay there again. However, if the heat doesn't bother you, it's a reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Homeboynot
Reviews.Content: Hotel 81 is a hotel chain in Singapore. Many of their hotels were obviously purchased from other owners and remodeled. The rooms are actually quite clean and modern. we spent one night in the Hotel 81 Princess in Geyland which is in the middle of the red light district. Many hotels in this and other areas rent by the hour. But here is the fatal flaw in this hotel chain - in all their hotels the mattresses are made, or at least covered, in Naugahyde plastic! The sheets are also about 90% plastic polyester. You cannot sleep on these beds! In my 40 years of world travels this was the worst mattress I have ever slept on. The sheets will slide around and off the bed and to top things off there is no mattress cover. I checked other Hotel 81's and they all have this horrible mattress. I told them I would rather sleep on a park bench which would have been more comfortable! We booked over the Internet for three nights but left after one night. They tried to charge us a one night penalty for "cancelling" but this was not a cancellation it was rejecting a room that was uninhabitible. They did refund our money for the extra two nights. No free Wi-Fi in these hotels. Our room at the Princess was postage stamp size and they mounted the small flat screen TV so that when you moved around the bed your head would impact the TV stand on the wall. If it weren't for the mattress and sheets this would have been a decent place to stay at a reasonable price for expensive Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY CLEAN AND FUNCTIONAL MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: zuhur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in many hotel 81. But this one is the best. These hotel 81 s are all located in Geylang which is considered to be Red Light area. Yet these are the hotels with clean records. In my opinion "princess" of hotel 81 is really very good. This time when I had the problem with my room's sink getting clogged and found it at around 1:30 am. I was quite hesitant in calling the reception at that hour fearing that they would suggest me to change the room. To my surprise, there was this handyman who knocked only 10 minutes later. He came in and temporarily fixed it. It was however, fixed again properly in the morning without me reminding then. A very nice budget motel for a place like Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful budget hotel for the broadminded”
Reviews.Author: DrDaveCumbria_UK
Reviews.Content: Great start - we arrived here after a 12 hour flight at 10am and they let us check straight in to our room with no quibbles and a smile to boot. Yes, this hotel is in the middle of the red light district and yes, this hotel is used by prostitutes and their clients. But - and it's a big but - we did not feel any sense of threat or unease as a result of this. Thursday night was very quiet, Friday night was a little more active (in a 'Meg Ryan in the cafe' sort of way at one point) but really, we slept very well both nights we were there. Air conditioniong fine and functional, room small but adequate, reasonable amount of fairly hot water for baths/showers, and free internet connection in the room. Desk staff were helpul and friendly throughout. The other good thing about this hotel is that it's 50 yards from Geylang Rd, where there are all sorts of interesting and cheap food haunts - whether you fancy Chilli Crab (try No Signboard Seafood restaurant at No. 412) or frog porridge or something a little more mundane.

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel in every sense”
Reviews.Author: byjing0h
Reviews.Content: Taxi cost S17.40 from Changi airport to the hotel. The return cab fare will include a booking fee if you ask the hotel to call a taxi for you. Tiny room, no fridge. It was a non smoking room but it was obvious from burn marks on the table and bathroom sink etc that people do smoke in here. Staff were efficient and helpful but also very business like – not overly friendly. All the hotels in this area are in the budget category – a very basic no frills set up. Cable broadband is available in the room at an additional cost. The shower/toilet area is tiny and stepping out of the bath can be a bit tricky and slippery as there is nothing to hold on to. No shower curtain so the whole area gets wet. The only power socket available (apart from the television socket) was where the kettle plugs in but it had a switch at the front that made it impossible to plug in my adaptor.. Each room is supplied daily with two packets of a coffee/milk/sugar mix . I stayed at two different hotels in the same location a week apart. On both occasions (late evening) I was told that the airport shuttle bus does not go to Geylang “at this hour”. Same price range in both hotels and almost identical room size and facilities although this room seemed to be in better condition than the room at the Frangrance hotel. The rooms are fairly clean but be prepared for a few marks/dents on the walls and furniture. The double bed was reasonably comfortable but the air-conditioning unit is a little noisy. Accommodation in Singapore is very expensive, if all you want is a place to rest and sleep stay here and spend the money you save on some duty free shopping. If you book online via an agent you will get the room at a substantial discount to the hotel’s advertised rates. There are plenty of 7/11 type convenience stores close by as well as lots of eating-houses. The menus at these places are very traditional with dishes with names that were very unfamiliar to me. But if you take your time to find out what’s in the dishes you should find something to suit your palate. Take-away coffee is served in a small plastic bag with handles and a straw. I did not see any cafes that sell western type food nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: janewdc
Reviews.Content: We waited until the last minute to make our reservation for Singapore, but we had no idea everything would be so full, and only by chance did we find Hotel 81 Princess. We arrived very late and in a matter of minutes we were resting in our bed. The room was clean, a good value for Singapore. About 5 blocks (more or less) from the metro station. It was a little far but manageable. The first night my husband sensed the smell of smoke so be sure to ask for a non smoking room. It's a good, not very expensive option.

Reviews.Title: “Only for singles”
Reviews.Author: Doctorneel
Reviews.Content: Right in the red light areas of Singapore. Just ok for singles to spend the night if you are on business in Singapore and on a budget. Yes the hotel is really cheap and you get exactly what you pay for. The room is 8 feet by 8 feet only. A small tv high up on the wall. A water kettle with tea and coffee. The bath is so small you really have a tight squeeze. No cupboard , no fridge. I was lucky that i got a room facing the outside. Most of the rooms just face a wall. And some rooms have no windows at all. But the advantages are there. Lots of cheap restaurants around. Close to the bus stops and the MRT. DO NOT go with family as after sundown the lorongs around are full of girls soliciting their busness, and it is a rough area.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LozzaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel as we were arriving late evening and leaving at lunchtime the next day and didn't want to pay high Singapore hotel prices in transit. The room was small but clean and so was the bathroom. It had a shower over the bath and you could nearly sit on the loo to clean your teeth! The reception staff were friendly and even though the hotel is in the red light district we saw nothing offensive at all. It was very tame for that sort of area. The hotel was close to lots of places to eat and bars and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a cheap room while passing through. We didn't realise until later but we were right near an MRT station and could have used the train rather than a taxi to get to the airport, but the taxi was less than $20.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, seedy location”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 81 Princess for 2 nites. For Singapore, where hotrel rates have gone throught the roof, the Hotel 81 Princess is a bargain. The room was on the small side, but big enough to move around in. Room and bathroom were clean, but did notice mildew around the tiles in the tub. Staff is friendly and helpful. The negatives include the area, Geyland. The hotel is right in the middle of the red light district and when I checked in at 3AM, there was a short line of "couples" As a single male, this did not bother me, although the ladies were trying to solicit me everytime I walked out of the hotel. There is a bus to downtown about 10 minutes away and there are numrous 24 hour cheap eating or hawkers centers. I would only recommend this hotel if you are arriving late and just need a few hours sleep or you are really on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly ssurprised”
Reviews.Author: JohnK_1602
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a one night transit and I was looking for something cheap only to be pleasantly surprised with the stay. The location may be questionable for some people but I had no issues what so ever. Check in was very quick and easy and I was given a basic room with a clean bed, towels and also included a bottle of water and a cup of noodles. I was very hungry after the flight in from Sydney and there are plenty of places to eat nearby on Geylang Road. I found a place that had fantastic lamb chops and could not help myself so had a second serving. Great value as the total cost of the 2 servings plus a bottle of beer was <SG$20. Afterwards I walked up and down Geylang road and visited some karaoke places before turning in for the night. At no stage did I feel threatened. I had a peaceful sleep so I do not understand some of the comments about hotels in Geylang not being quiet. Taxi to and from the airport is only ~SG$15 each way and I had no problem getting a taxi the next morning back to the airport. I would have like to stay here in September during another transit but unfortunately I picked the night of the F1 Grand Prix and this place is now booked out.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy but clean”
Reviews.Author: jamesf123
Reviews.Content: Even though this place was in a seedy area the food etc. around there is great and I found the rest of Singapore quite sterile. It is just down the road from the famous No Signboard Seafood restaurant (pepper crabs!!!) Note the hotel is directly across the road from the main strip of hookers in Singapore, expect 100+ working girls, simply walking on the otherside of the street will avoid a lot of propositioning however. We never felt unsafe but that generally happens when you are a 6'4'' male I guess. Rooms were clean, but quite cramped, but for AU$50 a night who cares compared to the rest of Singapore? I wouldn't stay here for a long time but for a couple of nights during an extended stopover it was great and close to an MRT station.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 81 - Princess
HotelInfo.Address: 21 Lorong 12 Geylang, Singapore 399001, Singapore
